titleStmt.title: A note by ʿāqābe saʿāt of Maṭāʿ Yǝrdǝʾanna Krǝstos
l'acte nᵒ 7
CCR 7 II parte

editionStmt.p: The encoding was carried out by Nafisa Valieva thanks to the project HornEast https://cordis.europa.eu/project/id/726206 that has received funding from the European Research Council (ERC) under the European Union’s Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme (Grant agreement No. 726206).

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

abstract.p: This document, part of the document number 7 in Carlo Conti Rossini's edition, part II of CCR 7 according to Alessandro Bausi's system of reference. While there are reasons to consider part I and part II of CCR 7 according to Bausi's system of reference as two parts one document, here they are treated as two documents on the basis of codicological disposition and mise en texte. The handwriting of this document is the same as in CCR 7. The document is attested twice, once on the recto of the folium with CCR 8, while writing was evaluated as potentially contemporary or close to Lālibalā's reign. Further, with one significant innovation, this document was presumably copied into a small quire, which contains a number of documents likely copied from older documents (originals?) in the sixteenth century.
